...长城骗局（英语：Great Wall of China hoax）是一则由美国记者伪造的报道，1899年6月25日刊登在美国报纸上，内容为美国商人想竞标拆掉长城并在原处建设道路。1939年，一名丹佛的作曲家Harry Lee Wilber在杂志上的一篇文章声称1899的这个报道是1900年义和团运动的导火索。这个说法成为都市传说广为流传，后.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (as a verb): probably a contraction of hocus

entry.def: A hoax is a trick in which someone tells people a lie, for example that there is a bomb somewhere when there is not, or that a picture is genuine when it is not.

example.ex: A series of bomb hoaxes has disrupted Christmas shopping in the city centre...
example.tran: 一系列炸弹假警报扰乱了市中心的圣诞节购物活动。

example.ex: He denied making the hoax call but was convicted after a short trial.
example.tran: 他否认打过恶作剧电话，但经过一番短暂的审讯后被判有罪。

means.word_mean: 1. something intended to deceive; deliberate trickery intended to gain an advantage
1. subject to a playful hoax or joke
